data.title: News Archives — Page 524 of 639 — SonicScoop
data.meta_description: Creative Techniques & Technology for Music & Audio Production
data.text:
WAVES Announces Modeled Plug-In Version of APHEX Vintage Aural Exciter

WavesAudio, in association with Aphex, has announced the release of their modeled plug-in version of the original Aphex Aural Exciter.

The new plug-in is officially called the Waves Aphex Vintage Aural Exciter, and is based on one of the two original tube-powered prototype units developed by Aphex during the mid-seventies. Read more...

Yessian Produces Dream-Pop “Don’t Fence Me In” For Wieden + Kennedy Nokia Spot

Yessian recently partnered with Wieden + Kennedy New York to provide music for a Nokia spot which aired during the Grammy Awards and will air again during the Oscars this weekend.

Watch the spot here.

Directed by Malcolm Venville of Anonymous Content, “Don’t Fence Me In” features the new Nokia Read more...

4 GRAMMY Award Wins Connect to Stadium Red Studios in Rap, Classical, Choral Categories

Stadiumred Studios in NYC announced that four of the Grammy nominations that the facility participated in were winners at the 53rd Annual Grammy Awards, held Sunday, Feb. 13th in Los Angeles.

The wins are:

— Best Rap Album: Stadium Red team member Just Blaze (Producer) is credited on Eminem’s Recovery Read more...

Spectrasonics Omnisphere 1.5 & Omni TR Controller iPad App Now Available

Spectrasonics Omnisphere is now available in version 1.5, with new features including “The Orb” interface offering real-time synthesis manipulation capabilities.

The update also includes expanded additions to the synthesis engine and user interface and a host of user-requested features such as the new 5-Column Browser view and support for polyphonic Read more...

The Pyramid Recording Collective Expands with New Staff Additions

The Pyramid Recording Collective announced that it has made a number of staffing additions. Headquartered in Koreatown, Pyramid was founded in 1976 and is home to a vintage custom API console, among other technical highlights.

The Collective’s founding members, Head Engineer Denise Barbarita, Mathew Leland, and Robert L. Smith, have Read more...
